Administration of C. sativus (30 mg/day) for treatment of mild-to-moderate AD in the patients of 55 years and older was found to be as effective as donepezil and the frequency of saffron extract side effects was similar to those of donepezil except for vomiting.
25 Similarly, the uses of saffron in 46 patients with mild-to-moderate AD for 16 weeks improved the cognitive functions.
26 Saffron extract (30 mg/day) for six-week was effective in the treatment of mild to moderate depression similar to the effects of fluoxetine and imipramine (100 mg/day).
27 In a double-blind clinical trial the efficacy of co-administration of hydro-alcoholic extract of C. sativus (40 and 80 mg) and fluoxetine (30 mg/day) for six weeks was investigated. The results showed that a dose of C. sativus 80 mg and fluoxetine (30 mg/day) was effective than that of C. sativus 40 mg to treat mild to moderate depressive disorders.
